thread.title: Bellevue wins NOL title over Shelby
thread.title_full: Bellevue wins NOL title over Shelby

title: Bellevue wins NOL title over Shelby
text:
Bellevue wins NOL title over Shelby Rich McGowan , Reporter 9:59 p.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Bellevue's Seth Linder scores a touchdown against Shelby on Friday night. (Photo: Molly Corfman/The News-Messenger) 16 CONNECT 9 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BELLEVUE — For the first time since 2004, the Bellevue Redmen can once again call themselves Northern Ohio League champions. 
The Redmen offense could not be slowed down while the defense kept Shelby out of sync most of the night en route to a 42-14 victory Friday. 
“NOL championships are special and they haven’t always come easy around here,” Bellevue coach Ed Nasonti said. “We’ve won 24 of them, the most in the league, but it took 46 years to win the first 12.” 
KEY TO THE GAME 
Shelby found itself within shouting distance of getting itself back in the ballgame early in the third quarter but, instead, Bellevue put the Whippets away. Shelby took the opening possession of the second half inside the Redmen 5-yard line. Bellevue, however, held its ground and forced a turnover on downs, taking possession at the 19-yard line after a penalty on the Shelby sideline. 
The Redmen marched down the field in eight plays and grew their lead to 36-6 on a 31-yard touchdown run by Bryce Ray. 
“I told my seniors I’m sorry because we were unable to get our No. 1 goal,” said Shelby coach Eric Will, whose team could have won at least a share of the league crown with a win. “I told our underclassmen, this is the gap. Bellevue has the league right now and they’re going to continue to have the league until someone takes it from them.” 
BELLEVUE HIGHLIGHTS 
The Redmen moved the ball at will against the Whippets. Alec Foos and Bryce Ray combined for 185 rushing yards in the first half alone on their way to a 28-6 halftime lead. Foos ran for touchdowns of 8, 1 and 4 yards while also throwing a 13-yard touchdown pass to Seth Linder, who made a terrific catch in the end zone with 22 seconds remaining in the second quarter. The Redmen defense was outstanding after giving up a touchdown on the first Shelby possession of the game. Bellevue allowed Shelby just three first downs thereafter, one coming on a Whippet fake punt. Foos then added another touchdown run, from 2 yards out, midway throughout the fourth quarter for a 42-14 lead. 
Ray finished the night with 216 yards while Foos rushed for 172. 
SHLEBY HIGHLIGHTS 
The Whippets came out firing on offense, driving 65 yards on just six plays and 90 seconds, capped by a Devin Tuttle 23-yard pass from Brennan Armstrong. After that, however, the Whippets struggled as the Redmen defense made adjustments to slow the Whippets. Of Shelby’s 118 first-half yards, only 53 came after its opening possession. Shelby tried to generate momentum by running a fake punt on fourth-and-four. The Whippets converted the first down, but Bellevue forced a punt just three plays later. 
Shelby’s offense improved in the third quarter, twice marching deep into Redmen territory, but scoring just once, on a 16-yard touchdown pass from Armstrong to Brandon Schneider on the final play of the third quarter, trimming the deficit to 36-14. 
Shelby totaled 286 yards of offense led by Armstrong's 186 yards on 16-of-26 passing. 16 CONNECT 9 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://ohne.ws/1S1HLUy TOP VIDEOS
